column4: How do I close the update manager if a terminal won';t come up
do you get a Run dialog with Alt-F2?
I'd follow KlrSpz's suggestion then and try a Ctrl-Alt-Backspace
& klrspz: ctrl alt bckspace does nothing :(
I suspect your keyboard is frozen then. Add the Force-Quit applet to the panel and use that to terminate the update manager
that might be it, my  caps lock key won't light up anything
right-click the panel, select Add to Panel, find the ForceQuit applet in the list and add it
you may have to hold Ctrl and Alt and PrtScrn (SysRq), then hit R
it looks like im going to have to forcefully restart the computer
try a "soft" shutdown using the Quit icon first
okay, if you have to cut the power, there's always a small risk of data loss (very small actually, thanks to ext3), but if you have exhausted all other options, go ahead.
